IncidentSuppNarrative.NarrativeText: Mobile Video Recording: D-27 is equipped with MVR/BWC. Interaction captured. Runaway: Haylee Renee Crawford DOB: 09/12/2006 2/F 46 Smith Avenue Aberdeen, Maryland 21001 Person of Interest: Cooper Charles Hawes 1/14/2004 2/M 12200 Marc Lane Glen Arm, Maryland 21057 Legal Guardians: Mary Sue Gilmer (Aunt) Benjamin Gilmer (Uncle) 46 Smith Avenue Aberdeen Maryland, 21001 Witness-Neighorhood Check: The following Locations were checked for Crawfords whereabouts: The Arrow Center 2408 Creswell Road Bel Air Maryland, 21015 The Highlands School 2409 Creswell Road Bel Air Maryland, 21015 Cedar Lane Park 1100 Cedar Lane Bel Air Maryland, 21015 Fountain Green Elementary School 517 S Fountain Green Road Bel Air Maryland, 21015 Royal Farms 2699 Tobin Crossing Bel Air Maryland, 21014 Church Creek Elementary School 4299 Church Creek Road Belcamp, Maryland 21017 Guardian Residence 46 Smith Avenue Aberdeen, Maryland 21001 1914 Eloise Lane Edgewood, Maryland 21040 1904 Eloise Lane Edgewood, Maryland 21040 12200 Marc Lane Glen Arm, Maryland 21057 Action Taken: On 9/21/2023 at approximately 2111 hours I, TFC S McMachan #6940 of the Maryland State Police Bel Air Barracks was on duty, and operating Maryland State Police marked patrol vehicle D-27. At this time, I was dispatched to the Arrow Center, located at 2408 Creswell Road Bel Air Maryland, 21015, for report of a runaway juvenile. I arrived on scene and made contact with the complainant, Rachel Dickson, an employee of the Arrow Center. Dickson advised one of her residents, identified by name and date of birth and verified through Meters/NCIC as Haylee Renee Crawford (DOB: 9/12/2006 2/F), was last scene at approximately 2030 hours. At approximately 2102 hours, Crawford jumped out of her assigned room window and fled the facility. I was informed Crawford utilized snapchat and Instagram to communicate with her boyfriend, identified as Cooper Charles Hawes (DOB: 01/14/2004 2/M). Crawford intended to meet and flee with Hawes. It should be noted this is the second time Crawford fled this facility with Cooper. The Arrow Center believed her to be linked to the following areas: - Local Schools in the area - Aberdeen, where her legal guardians reside - Baltimore County where Hawes resides The Maryland State Police Bel Air Barrack made contact with Hawes mother, Sheila Lynn Hawes (DOB:3/30/1968 2/F) to inquire on Coopers whereabouts. Sheila attempted to call Cooper and was unable to get in touch with him. At approximately 2257 hours, Sheila contacted the Maryland State Police and advised her son Cooper, arrived at their residence, located at 12200 Marc Lane, Glen Arm Maryland, 21057 with Crawford with him. Crawford was transported to the Arrow Center. Crawford advised she has bad anxiety and wanted to smoked marijuana. Crawford advised she fled through the window and went to the church near the Arrow Center. Cooper picked her up at approximately 2115 hours and brought her marijuana. Cooper took Crawford to his residence, where she was located and picked up by the Maryland State Police. Crawford was released to the custody of the Arrow Center. I request this case be closed. All events occurred in Harford County, Maryland.
